page.title: 11Charterhouse School
page.content: Charterhouse School stands on a plateau above the River Wey looking out south over its playing fields to Hindhead and the Devil's Punchbowl. There are approximately 700 pupils in the school, 650 boys and 50 girls. All 650 boys are boarders but only 4 of the girls board. In the school there are 72 teachers. 20 of them are part-time music teachers. The school has at least a thousand rooms and halls, used for many different things. The classes vary from 6-25 pupils.The pupils ages vary from 13-18. Places need to be booked at birth. The headmaster is Peter Attenborough. The school covers 200 acres. It was built in 1611 in London and was transferred to Godalming in 1872.Educated at Charterhouse was Baden Powell, founder of the scouts.
